title: Interim European Finance Controller (12 months)
content:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is a world-famous brand with offices across the globe. Fender was born in Southern California and has built a worldwide influence beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument; it’s a cultural symbol that resonates globally.
We are searching for a Interim European Finance Controller (12 months) to join our team. This opportunity is based in our East Grinstead/London office. This is an 1 year Fixed Term Contract reporting to the EMEA Finance Director.
This role will be responsible for internal and external financial reporting for the German, Spanish, French and Scandinavian sales distribution regions.  Including oversight of fiscal and balance sheet control, supporting the annual audit process, and maintaining strong internal controls and governance.
Key relationships




Internal


External





US Group Finance
Sales operations
Senior leadership
Supply chain & warehousing
FP&A
IT




Auditors
Tax advisors
Various European Tax authorities
Banking





Main Responsibilities

Ensure compliance with all company policies and standard operating procedures, identify/establish internal controls, and ensure their operating effectiveness.
Financial & controlling oversight of 4 European Fender entities.
Line management, support, and development of a minimum of 2 Finance Managers covering the above regions.
Ensure month end accounts are submitted accurately according to specified corporate formats and deadlines.
Review and approval of month end journal entries and reconciliations in Blackline
Oversight of monthly, quarterly and annual balance sheet control account reconciliations.
Ensure accounting records are properly reconciled and that all aged items are resolved in a timely manner.
Responsible for the preparation, and submission of annual local statutory accounts.
Responsible for the preparation of Corporate Income Tax calculations.
Review and approval of regional VAT returns, EU Sales Lists, and duty administrative support
Responsibility for statutory and fiscal reporting, including company secretarial requirements.


Responsible for ensuring local compliance and controls are adhered to.
Responsibility for financial policies and procedures for the European regions.


Assist with Group and local Audit’s.


Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy of monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting.


Assisting with balance sheet forecast and annual budget, working with Hyperion, including variance analysis versus budget and prior year.
Provide further ad hoc support to the Finance Director where required.
Ad hoc projects and tasks.

This is an indication of the main responsibilities of the role and the Company reserves the right to amend the content of the role at its discretion.
Person Specification
Essential Skills/Knowledge/Experience

Qualified Accountant, ACA or ACCA, CIMA with more than 7 years post qualification experience
Experience of managing a team
Practical experience of statutory and fiscal reporting for medium sized companies
Knowledge of accounting under EU regulations
Prior experience of complex intercompany accounting
Proven VAT experience,
Strong excel & SAP experience
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Attention to detail
Deadline driven with the ability to remain calm under pressure
Proactive
Multi-tasking, flexible and adaptable
Ability to work at pace

Desirable Skills/Knowledge/Experience

Exposure to FX and multi-currency accounting
Previous exposure to inventory reconciliation and reporting
Knowledge/Experience of Intrastat & EU Sales Listing,
Knowledge of US/IFRS GAAP,
AS400,
Hyperion,
Blackline
